pullRequest.title: Testsuite: Few changes to match our name conventions
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
Few minor changes to follow our name conventions.
We register the CentOS VM as a salt minion most of the time, thus
the prefix of the feature file must be min.


testsuite/features/secondary/min_centos_salt_install_package_and_patch.feature
Rename from minssh_centos_salt_install_package_and_patch.feature


testsuite/features/support/twopence_init.rb:
Add a label sle_ssh_tunnel_client matching the client hostname.


testsuite/documentation/cucumber-steps.md:
Document the new label.


testsuite/features/secondary/trad_ssh_tunnel.feature
Rename from trad_ssh_push.feature.  Use the new label.


testsuite/run_sets/secondary.yml


testsuite/run_sets/secondary_parallelizable.yml:
Update with the new names.


testsuite/features/secondary/min_ssh_tunnel.feature:
Be specific using the minion labels.


Links
Ports

Manager-4.1: https://github.com/SUSE/spacewalk/pull/13223 and https://github.com/SUSE/spacewalk/pull/13242
Manager-4.0: https://github.com/SUSE/spacewalk/pull/13222 and https://github.com/SUSE/spacewalk/pull/13241

Changelogs
If you don't need a changelog check, please mark this checkbox:

 No changelog needed

If you uncheck the checkbox after the PR is created, you will need to re-run changelog_test (see below)

nodes.bodyText: Leave "sle_client" in this line, because at this point it is still one :-)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -4,12 +4,12 @@
 Feature: Register a traditional system to be managed via SSH push
 
   Scenario: Delete the traditional client for SSH reverse bootstrap
-    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_client"
+    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"

@@ -4,12 +4,12 @@
 Feature: Register a traditional system to be managed via SSH push
 
   Scenario: Delete the traditional client for SSH reverse bootstrap
-    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_client"
+    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"
     When I follow "Delete System"
     Then I should see a "Confirm System Profile Deletion" text
     When I click on "Delete Profile"
     And I wait until I see "has been deleted" text
-    Then "sle_client" should not be registered
+    Then "sle_ssh_tunnel_client" should not be registered

nodes.bodyText: it's a normal client again => use "sle_client" on this line
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -18,26 +18,26 @@ Feature: Register a traditional system to be managed via SSH push
 
   Scenario: Register this client for SSH push via tunnel
     When I register this client for SSH push via tunnel
-    Then I should see "sle_client" via spacecmd
+    Then I should see "sle_ssh_tunnel_client" via spacecmd
 
   Scenario: Check this client's contact method
-    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_client"
+    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"
     Then I should see a "Push via SSH tunnel" text
 
   Scenario: Cleanup: delete the traditional SSH push client
-    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_client"
+    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"
     When I follow "Delete System"
     Then I should see a "Confirm System Profile Deletion" text
     When I click on "Delete Profile"
     And I wait until I see "has been deleted" text
-    Then "sle_client" should not be registered
+    Then "sle_ssh_tunnel_client" should not be registered
 
   Scenario: Cleanup: hosts file of traditional client via SSH tunnel
     Given I am on the Systems page
-    And I run "sed -i '/127.0.1.1/d' /etc/hosts" on "sle_client"
+    And I run "sed -i '/127.0.1.1/d' /etc/hosts" on "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"
     And I run "rm /srv/www/htdocs/pub/bootstrap/bootstrap-ssh-push-tunnel.sh" on "server"
-    And I remove server hostname from hosts file on "sle_client"
+    And I remove server hostname from hosts file on "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"
 
   Scenario: Cleanup: register a traditional client after SSH push tests
-    When I bootstrap traditional client "sle_client" using bootstrap script with activation key "1-SUSE-DEV-x86_64" from the proxy
-    Then I should see "sle_client" via spacecmd
+    When I bootstrap traditional client "sle_ssh_tunnel_client" using bootstrap script with activation key "1-SUSE-DEV-x86_64" from the proxy

@@ -18,26 +18,26 @@ Feature: Register a traditional system to be managed via SSH push
 
   Scenario: Register this client for SSH push via tunnel
     When I register this client for SSH push via tunnel
-    Then I should see "sle_client" via spacecmd
+    Then I should see "sle_ssh_tunnel_client" via spacecmd
 
   Scenario: Check this client's contact method
-    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_client"
+    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"
     Then I should see a "Push via SSH tunnel" text
 
   Scenario: Cleanup: delete the traditional SSH push client
-    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_client"
+    Given I am on the Systems overview page of this "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"
     When I follow "Delete System"
     Then I should see a "Confirm System Profile Deletion" text
     When I click on "Delete Profile"
     And I wait until I see "has been deleted" text
-    Then "sle_client" should not be registered
+    Then "sle_ssh_tunnel_client" should not be registered
 
   Scenario: Cleanup: hosts file of traditional client via SSH tunnel
     Given I am on the Systems page
-    And I run "sed -i '/127.0.1.1/d' /etc/hosts" on "sle_client"
+    And I run "sed -i '/127.0.1.1/d' /etc/hosts" on "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"
     And I run "rm /srv/www/htdocs/pub/bootstrap/bootstrap-ssh-push-tunnel.sh" on "server"
-    And I remove server hostname from hosts file on "sle_client"
+    And I remove server hostname from hosts file on "sle_ssh_tunnel_client"
 
   Scenario: Cleanup: register a traditional client after SSH push tests
-    When I bootstrap traditional client "sle_client" using bootstrap script with activation key "1-SUSE-DEV-x86_64" from the proxy
-    Then I should see "sle_client" via spacecmd
+    When I bootstrap traditional client "sle_ssh_tunnel_client" using bootstrap script with activation key "1-SUSE-DEV-x86_64" from the proxy
+    Then I should see "sle_ssh_tunnel_client" via spacecmd

nodes.bodyText: Please document it. We have a list in some .md file somewhere.

beforeCommit.message:
Testsuite: Few changes to match our name conventions

We register the CentOS VM as a salt minion most of the time, thus
the prefix of the feature file must be `min`.
- testsuite/features/secondary/min_centos_salt_install_package_and_patch.feature
Rename from minssh_centos_salt_install_package_and_patch.feature

- testsuite/features/support/twopence_init.rb:
Add a label `sle_ssh_tunnel_client` matching the client hostname.

- testsuite/features/secondary/trad_ssh_tunnel.feature
Rename from trad_ssh_push.feature.  Use the new label.

- testsuite/run_sets/secondary.yml
- testsuite/run_sets/secondary_parallelizable.yml:
Update with the new names.

nodes.bodyText: We still have some mixed names "SSH reverse bootstrap" , "minion for push via SSH tunnel", "salt minion after SSH push tests" 🤔
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -4,13 +4,13 @@
 Feature: Register a salt system to be managed via SSH tunnel
 
   Scenario: Delete the salt minion for SSH reverse bootstrap
